title: Altitude-Adjusted PERC Rule
description: Rules out pulmonary embolism (PE) if no criteria are present; includes adjustment for high altitude (>4000 ft) by removing oxygen saturation criterion. Used in patients with low pretest probability of PE (<15%) who live at high altitude.

parameters.name: high_altitude
parameters.description: Patient lives at high altitude (>4000 ft)

parameters.name: recent_surgery_trauma
parameters.description: Recent surgery or trauma (≤4 weeks ago requiring general anesthesia)

parameters.name: prior_pe_dvt
parameters.description: Prior history of PE or DVT

parameters.name: hormone_use
parameters.description: Hormone use (oral contraceptives, hormone replacement, or estrogenic hormones)

result.name: perc_result
result.description: PERC rule result and clinical recommendation

ranges.description: No criteria present - PE ruled out
ranges.interpretation: PERC rule criteria satisfied. No need for further workup, as <2% chance of PE. Patient can be safely discharged without additional testing for PE if clinician's pretest probability is <15%.

PERC rule not satisfied. Further workup for PE is indicated as one or more criteria are present. Consider D-dimer, CT pulmonary angiogram, or other appropriate diagnostic testing based on clinical judgment and pretest probability.

references: Wolf SJ, McCubbin TR, Nordenholz KE, Naviaux NW, Haukoos JS, Kline JA. Assessment of the pulmonary embolism rule-out criteria rule for evaluation of suspected pulmonary embolism in the emergency department. Am J Emerg Med. 2008 Feb;26(2):181-5. doi: 10.1016/j.ajem.2007.04.026.

Kline JA, Mitchell AM, Kabrhel C, Richman PB, Courtney DM. Clinical criteria to prevent unnecessary diagnostic testing in emergency department patients with suspected pulmonary embolism. J Thromb Haemost. 2004 Aug;2(8):1247-55. doi: 10.1111/j.1538-7836.2004.00790.x.

Kline JA, Courtney DM, Kabrhel C, Moore CL, Smithline HA, Plewa MC, et al. Prospective multicenter evaluation of the pulmonary embolism rule-out criteria. J Thromb Haemost. 2008 May;6(5):772-80. doi: 10.1111/j.1538-7836.2008.02944.x.
formula: PERC = Sum of positive criteria. If all 7 criteria are negative AND patient lives at high altitude (>4000 ft) AND pretest probability <15%, then PE is ruled out.
notes: This tool is specifically intended for patients with low risk for PE who live at high altitude (>4000 ft)
The altitude adjustment removes the oxygen saturation criterion (<95% on room air) that is present in the standard PERC rule, as normal SaO2 is naturally lower at high altitude
The rule is only valid when the clinician's gestalt pretest probability of PE is <15%
If any criterion is positive, further workup is needed regardless of pretest probability
The PERC rule should not be used in patients with high or intermediate pretest probability of PE
This rule was developed to help avoid unnecessary testing in very low-risk patients
